clinical_study.brief_title: Mild Versus Conventional Ovarian Stimulation for Poor Responders Undergoing In Vitro Fertilisation
clinical_study.official_title: Mild Versus Conventional Ovarian Stimulation for Poor Responders Undergoing In Vitro Fertilisation

lead_sponsor.agency: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

clinical_study.source: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will examine the balance between IVF success in terms of outcome parameters, using a mild ovarian stimulation protocol, opposing it to the conventional stimulation regimens in poor responders undergoing IVF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number/rate of participants whom the IVF cycle was cancelled
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the 1st week of ovarian stimulation, no oocytes at OR

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of fetal heart at transvaginal ultrasound at 6 weeks of gestation or 6 weeks after starting the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pregnancy loss before 20 weeks of gestation, after a positive pregnancy test
from start of stimulation until embryo transfer
from start of stimulation until ET
secondary_outcome.description: when premature ovulation was evident by the loss of follicle(s) prior to oocyte recovery, and in cases where there were no oocytes retrieved or no embryos produced for transfer and in failed fertilization

arm_group.description: 100 mg CC by day 2 till 6, plus antagonist plus gonadotrophin 150-200IO until HCG triggering
300-450 IU of FSH starting by day 2 of menstrual cycle together with a fixed dose of GnRH antagonist starting by day 6 till egg recovery, or same doses using a GnRH agonist long protocol

intervention.description: 100-150 mg of clomiphene citrate from day 2 till day 6 of the cycle and 150 mg of gonadotrophins as soon as 1 follicle is more than 14mm together with 1 fixed dose of GnRH antagonist until egg recovery
300-450 IU of FSH starting by day 2 of menstrual cycle together with a fixed dose of GnRH antagonist starting by day 6 till egg recovery, or same doses with GnRH agonist long protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- poor responders (age>40, previous POR, abnormal OR test)
- indication for IVF
- regular cycling patients
- BMI 19-35
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication for clomiphene citrate use or to GnRH agonists antagonists
- BMI > 35
